True size

okay so I have some thoughts on these. They are fine pants they look nice and they are not totally uncomfortable (although they do feel a bit like snow pants) they were exactly what I had expected given the price, but now I’m wearing them again after having them packed away for several months and I have gotten progressively more frustrated throughout the day with these pockets… they are the weirdest most difficult pockets I have ever seen. They are open there is no button or zipper, but it’s almost like the opening to the pocket is smaller then the actual pocket or something, but once you put your phone in there let me tell you it’s a whole battle to get it back out. I mean they are still fine pants and I will probably still wear them and just be frustrated each time I put something in my pocket, but I thought I’d still share with you all as you have a right to know.

I love it, the fit around my waist is great! However, it's a bit short. I do realize that my proportions are a bit awkward, but they weren't baggy, and I have to wear them low rise to get them to touch the floor. If you have long legs, consider this!  Also, the elastics on the bottom clean snapped. I'm not giving much off for this, because I wasn't planning on using them. However, they were very brittle. The first one broke on the first day I got them after some pulling, and I snapped the other by pulling hard (on purpose).

I've been on the hunt for a cute pair of track pants, but most of the time the ones I find are extremely expensive. These pants are really comfortable, they are also a really good length where if I wear them with sneakers they go past my ankle but don't touch the floor. They also have a string to cuff the bottoms if you'd like, so you're getting good quality for the price. I usually buy my bottoms in xl and am a size 18 since i'm on the curvier side, so I was taking a gamble by buying the pants in size large. Surprisingly they are quite stretchy and are not tight at all, definitely recommend!
